section.title: Adding microdata
section.para: Now that you know every part of J4Schema editor, let's start adding Schema.org information.
First of all, we have to add the itemtype property, so we can identify the subject of this block of text.

section.title: Adding the itemtype
section.para: Just select the entire text, explode the type tree until the Movie one and click on Add type button.
Great! You have just added a type to your text!

note.para: You can find the Movie type under Thing » Creative Work » Movie

section.para: Now your text should be something like this:

example.title: HTML after type add
example.programlisting:
Avatar

Director: James Cameron (born August 16, 1954) Science fiction Trailer

note.para: As you can see, the itemscope property has empty attributes; don't worry! J4Schema cleanup plugin will remove these quotes for you.

section.title: Adding attributes
section.para:
Now you have access to "Movie" and its parents properties; select

Avatar

and explode the node Thing on the Attribute node.
Select the attribute name and press the Add attribute button. If you have done every right, your text should look like this:

example.title: HTML after adding "name" attribute
example.programlisting:
Avatar

Director: James Cameron (born August 16, 1954) Science fiction Trailer

section.para: In the same way, we can add more information about the movie genre: select the text Science fiction and look for the Genre attribute.
You'll find it in the CreativeWork node, since every type shares its attributes with its parent; now add it as we did before.
Now select the trailer link (Trailer) and select the Trailer attribute.
As you can see in the box on the right, List of possible Values, you can choose to add it as plain property or to create another itemtype block. For the moment, just add it as property.
Your text should be like this:

example.title: HTML after adding attributes
example.programlisting:
Avatar

Director: James Cameron (born August 16, 1954) Science fiction Trailer
